<a href="https://www.piquetea.com/products/elderberry-liposomal-vitamin-c?rfsn=5393196.4b9bb7&utm_source=affiliate&utm_medium=email_campaign&utm_campaign=dailyimmune&utm_content=mar21_morningbrew" style="border-bottom:none!important;" target="_blank" class=""><img alt="Pique" style="width:100%;max-width: 180px; display: inline; vertical-align: middle;" width="180" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL2NvbXBhbnkvbG9nby81MjQvMTYxNDg2NDg4MC1QaXF1ZV9Mb2dvXzE0MDB4NzAwV2hpdGVCRy5wbmciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJjb21ldC1tb3JuaW5nYnJldyIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19"></a>

<td style="padding-top:20px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Good morning. </strong>It’s Saturday and you deserve some good news, so we’re pleased to inform you that Wisdom the albatross <a href="https://www.npr.org/2021/03/05/973992408/wisdom-the-albatross-now-70-hatches-yet-another-chick" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">successfully hatched</a> her latest chick. Discovered by biologists in 1956, Wisdom is at least 70 years old, making her the oldest known wild bird. She still flies as many as 1,000 miles in a single foraging expedition.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Her advice to the younger generation? Think before you tweet.</p>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
HEALTH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/03/05/conversation-around-vaccine-passports-heats?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Vaccine Passports Offer a Whole New World
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/03/05/conversation-around-vaccine-passports-heats" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Vaccine passports Aladdin " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80MjY3L3ZhY2NpbmVfcGFzc3BvcnRzX2FsYWRkaW4uanBlZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Disney</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">This week, more leaders floated ideas for a Covid-19 “vaccine passport” that would allow the increasing number of vaccinated people to start living like it’s 2019 again. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What’s a vaccine passport? </strong></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>It’s a digital health pass showing that you’ve gotten your Covid-19 shot(s). Think of it like a “Get Out of Pandemic Free” card.</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Documentation proving that you’ve been vaccinated against certain diseases is </span><span><a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/03/05/digital-health-passport-will-i-need-proof-of-vaccine-to-travel-abroad.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">not new</a></span><span>, CNBC notes. What </span><span><em>is </em></span><span>new is that the documentation being proposed now is purely digital, rather than physical “yellow cards.” </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The latest news: </strong>On Monday, European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen introduced the concept of a “<a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/03/01/world/eu-vaccine-passport.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Digital Green Pass</a>,” a certificate that will let vaccinated Europeans travel between EU countries or even venture abroad. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The Digital Green Pass and other efforts like it (such as the system already implemented in Israel) have sparked a <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/03/02/world/europe/passports-covid-vaccine.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">dialogue</a> over whether vaccine passports are necessary for economic revival or an ethical minefield waiting to explode.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0"><strong style="color:#000">Who’s in favor? </strong></h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Vaccinated people, probably. And pretty much all the folks who’ve been crushed financially by the pandemic: the tourism, leisure, and hospitality sectors. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The International Air Transport Association is currently testing a digital pass with 30 airlines that would allow for quarantine-free air travel, which is what the industry craves the most.</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Some cruise lines have also announced they’ll </span><span><a href="https://www.cntraveler.com/story/cruise-lines-are-beginning-to-announce-vaccination-requirements-for-guests?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">require vaccination</a></span><span> for guests and crew for the privilege of sailing the Covid-free seas. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">And what could go wrong?  </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">That word we just wrote in the sentence above: “privilege.” Critics of digital health passes say they have the potential to <a href="https://www.scientificamerican.com/article/how-to-make-immunity-passports-more-ethical/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">further divide populations</a> into “have” and “have-nots” simply based on who is able to get a vaccine. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">And, as with anything that can be described as a “digital health pass,” people are raising concerns over privacy and the protection of personal data. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>expect the discussion around vaccine passports to heat up even more, although actual implementation may not happen until the summer. The Digital Green Pass would take at least three months to get up and running, the European Commission said.</p>

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
COVID
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/03/05/covid-vaccine-tracker?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Covid Vaccine Tracker
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/03/05/covid-vaccine-tracker" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Vaccine tracker" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80MjA0L3ZhY2NpbmVfdHJhY2tlci5KUEciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Passports aside, here’s a look at where the vaccine rollout stands. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">In the US...</strong></span><span>82.6 million doses, or 24.9 doses for every 100 people, have been administered, </span><span><a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/graphics/covid-vaccine-tracker-global-distribution/?sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">according to Bloomberg</a></span><span>. That’s up from 70.5 million doses last Saturday. 8.4% of the US population is now fully vaccinated.</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Around the world…</strong></span><span>279 million doses have been administered in 111 different countries, up from 231 million doses in 100 countries last week.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">The latest updates</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Hot out of the gate:</strong> Covax, the international relief effort to help supply vaccines to low-income countries, delivered <a href="https://www.cnn.com/world/live-news/coronavirus-pandemic-vaccine-updates-03-05-21/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">20 million doses to 20 countries</a> in its first week of distribution. The UN-backed organization’s goal is to deliver 2 billion doses by the end of the year. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">#Blocked</strong>: Earlier this week, Italy <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-03-05/australia-urges-eu-review-after-italy-blocks-astrazeneca-doses?sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">blocked</a> a shipment of AstraZeneca vaccine doses headed for Australia on the grounds that it needed them more than the Aussies did. France backed Italy’s decision, escalating a high-profile case of “vaccine nationalism.” </p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SOCIAL MEDIA
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/03/05/tom-cruise-deepfakes-go-viral-tiktok?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
You Won’t Believe What Tom Cruise Didn’t Do
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/03/05/tom-cruise-deepfakes-go-viral-tiktok" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Tom Cruise deepfake" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80MjY1L3RvbV9jcnVpc2VfZGVlcGZha2UucG5nIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>@deeptomcruise on TikTok</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">After the whole jumping-on-Oprah’s-couch thing, it’s understandable that people will believe Tom Cruise is capable of anything. But videos that went viral on TikTok this week of Cruise golfing and performing magic tricks were actually <em>deepfakes</em>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Deepfake, (dēpfāk), </strong><strong style="color:#000"><em>noun</em></strong><strong style="color:#000">.</strong> a digitally manipulated video. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Use it in a sentence: Tom Cruise’s face was glommed onto someone else’s body in a series of </span><span><em>deepfakes</em></span><span> this week. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Visual effects specialist Chris Ume spent months creating the convincing videos, which star a Tom Cruise impersonator augmented with VFX and CGI. Ume <a href="https://www.theverge.com/2021/3/5/22314980/tom-cruise-deepfake-tiktok-videos-ai-impersonator-chris-ume-miles-fisher?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">told The Verge</a> his videos are meant to prove, “You can’t [make convincing deepfakes] by just pressing a button.” </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Despite his intentions, the videos highlight existing concerns about deepfake technology and how social media companies guard their platforms against misinformation. TikTok <a href="https://www.ft.com/content/721da1df-a1e5-4e2f-97fe-6de633ed4826?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">banned</a> manipulated content in August, but a spokesperson said parodies like Ume’s don’t count. The videos <a href="https://www.tiktok.com/@deeptomcruise?lang=en&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">are still live</a> as of last night. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out:</strong> With the exception of Internet Explorer, technology tends to improve over time. Deepfakes will only get a) more realistic and b) easier to make.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">+</strong> <strong style="color:#000">Optional homework: </strong>We wrote about deepfakes and how to detect them in our <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/10/28/5-12-steps-fact-checking-social-media-feed?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">guide to fact-checking your social media feed</a>.</p>

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SPONSORED BY PIQUE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">

No Neon Pee With This Vitamin C

</p>

<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><a href="https://www.piquetea.com/products/elderberry-liposomal-vitamin-c?rfsn=5393196.4b9bb7&utm_source=affiliate&utm_medium=email_campaign&utm_campaign=dailyimmune&utm_content=mar21_morningbrew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Pique’s Daily Immune, Elderberry Liposomal C</a> is a <strong style="color:#000">game-changer in Vitamin C supplements</strong>. Yep, its effectiveness has to do with your pee.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">You see, Vitamin C supplements can make your pee glow neon—which we can all agree is a DISCONCERTING color. Turns out that your bod might have a hard time absorbing over 1000mg of Vitamin C, which is why you may notice that neon glow after taking some Vitamin C supplements.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But there be no neon pee with Pique Vitamin C: Their <a href="https://www.piquetea.com/products/elderberry-liposomal-vitamin-c?rfsn=5393196.4b9bb7&utm_source=affiliate&utm_medium=email_campaign&utm_campaign=dailyimmune&utm_content=mar21_morningbrew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Daily Immune supplement</a> pairs 1000mg of Vitamin C<strong style="color:#000"> </strong>with <strong style="color:#000">cutting-edge encapsulation and absorption tech</strong> to help your bod out.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">You even get the added boost of elderberry concentrate (the equivalent of up to 13g of fresh elderberries). Not only does Pique dial in the science of Vitamin C absorption, but also—like all their other products—Daily Immune harnesses the <strong style="color:#000">ancient health benefits of plants. </strong></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Get 5% off </strong>Pique’s <a href="https://www.piquetea.com/products/elderberry-liposomal-vitamin-c?rfsn=5393196.4b9bb7&utm_source=affiliate&utm_medium=email_campaign&utm_campaign=dailyimmune&utm_content=mar21_morningbrew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">tasty, plant-based Daily Immune supplement here</a>.</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GRAB BAG
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/03/05/key-performance-indicators-march-6?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Key Performance Indicators
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/03/05/key-performance-indicators-march-6" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="SAN FRANCISCO, CALIFORNIA - MARCH 04: Jeans are displayed at a Gap store..." style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80MjY0L2dhcF90b19hbm5vdW5jZV9xNF9lYXJuaW4uanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Justin Sullivan/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote:</strong> “We do think there’s going to be this peacocking effect that happens, as people emerge from Covid.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Gap CEO Sonia Syngal told the WSJ she’s <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/gap-ceo-predicts-peacocking-effect-as-people-emerge-from-covid-19-pandemic-11614892544?campaign_id=4&emc=edit_dk_20210305&instance_id=27753&mod=hp_lista_pos2&nl=dealbook&regi_id=83342785&segment_id=52844&te=1&user_id=6e8f5c5256f51c870f4df90ca819260d&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">seeing signs</a> that shoppers are ready to start venturing outside the Comfort & Leisure aisle for the first time in a while. Urban Outfitters’s CEO also said this week that he’s noticed “‘<a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/03/05/americans-ready-to-restock-wardrobe-but-shipping-snafus-may-plague-retailers.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">go-out fashion</a>’ start to take hold.” </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat: </strong>8% more people died in motor vehicle crashes last year in the US than in 2019, according to preliminary data from the National Safety Council. That’s shocking considering total miles driven <a href="https://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/motor-vehicle-deaths-in-2020-estimated-to-be-highest-in-13-years-despite-dramatic-drops-in-miles-driven-301240410.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">dropped 13%</a> due to the pandemic.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Read:</strong> Why millennials love Gucci. (<a href="https://www.businessinsider.com/gucci-millennials-teens-love-designer-comeback-2018-11?utm_source=feedly&utm_medium=webfeeds&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Business Insider</a>)</p>

</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">

<img alt="Amazon best sellers" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80MjY2L2FtYXpvbl9iZXN0X3NlbGxlcnMucG5nIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Amazon screenshot</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Dr. Seuss’s greatest hits have <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/03/05/dr-seuss-books-shoot-to-the-top-of-amazons-bestseller-list.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">taken over</a> the Amazon US bestsellers list. 15 books on Amazon’s Top 20 list were Seuss publications as of Friday morning. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The backstory: </strong>Dr. Seuss Enterprises, which runs Theodore Seuss Geisel’s estate, discontinued six of the author’s books on Tuesday, the author’s 117th birthday, over racist imagery. It <a href="https://www.seussville.com/statement-from-dr-seuss-enterprises/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">explained</a> in a statement, “These books portray people in ways that are hurtful and wrong.” </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out:</strong> The announcement led to a big “<a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/03/05/learning/lesson-of-the-day-dr-seuss-books-are-pulled-and-a-cancel-culture-controversy-erupts.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">cancel culture</a>” debate over the author’s legacy, causing the books that <em>weren't</em> discontinued to become a hotter buy than Thneeds. </p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
BREW'S BETS
</h3>
</td>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">A new music Friday for the ages: </strong>Drake, Justin Bieber, Bruno Mars + Anderson .Paak, and approximately 1 million other amazing artists all released new music yesterday. <a href="https://open.spotify.com/playlist/37i9dQZF1DX4JAvHpjipBk?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Groove along here</a>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Weekend Conversation Starters:</strong></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>What do you call the night before Halloween? Despite only having 28 days to do it, US employers \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-economy/u-s-labor-market-roars-back-full-recovery-still-years-away-idUSKBN2AX0CY?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eadded 379,000 jobs\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e last month, more than economists expected. The unemployment rate ticked down to 6.2%.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eMarkets: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eStocks \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/03/04/stock-market-open-to-close-news.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epopped\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, and, despite all the fingernail-biting, the S\u0026P and Dow actually closed higher for the week. The tech-heavy Nasdaq, though, posted its third straight weekly decline.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c/th\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nHEALTH\n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/03/05/conversation-around-vaccine-passports-heats?email={{profile.email}}\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nVaccine Passports Offer a Whole New World\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/03/05/conversation-around-vaccine-passports-heats\" style=\"text-decoration:none;border:none;\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Vaccine passports Aladdin \" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80MjY3L3ZhY2NpbmVfcGFzc3BvcnRzX2FsYWRkaW4uanBlZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19\"\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eDisney\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThis week, more leaders floated ideas for a Covid-19 “vaccine passport” that would allow the increasing number of vaccinated people to start living like it’s 2019 again. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat’s a vaccine passport? \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIt’s a digital health pass showing that you’ve gotten your Covid-19 shot(s). Think of it like a “Get Out of Pandemic Free” card.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eDocumentation proving that you’ve been vaccinated against certain diseases is \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/03/05/digital-health-passport-will-i-need-proof-of-vaccine-to-travel-abroad.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003enot new\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, CNBC notes. What \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003eis \u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003enew is that the documentation being proposed now is purely digital, rather than physical “yellow cards.” \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe latest news: \u003c/strong\u003eOn Monday, European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen introduced the concept of a “\u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2021/03/01/world/eu-vaccine-passport.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eDigital Green Pass\u003c/a\u003e,” a certificate that will let vaccinated Europeans travel between EU countries or even venture abroad. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe Digital Green Pass and other efforts like it (such as the system already implemented in Israel) have sparked a \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2021/03/02/world/europe/passports-covid-vaccine.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edialogue\u003c/a\u003e over whether vaccine passports are necessary for economic revival or an ethical minefield waiting to explode.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWho’s in favor? \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eVaccinated people, probably. And pretty much all the folks who’ve been crushed financially by the pandemic: the tourism, leisure, and hospitality sectors. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe International Air Transport Association is currently testing a digital pass with 30 airlines that would allow for quarantine-free air travel, which is what the industry craves the most.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eSome cruise lines have also announced they’ll \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cntraveler.com/story/cruise-lines-are-beginning-to-announce-vaccination-requirements-for-guests?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erequire vaccination\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e for guests and crew for the privilege of sailing the Covid-free seas. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eAnd what could go wrong?  \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThat word we just wrote in the sentence above: “privilege.” Critics of digital health passes say they have the potential to \u003ca href=\"https://www.scientificamerican.com/article/how-to-make-immunity-passports-more-ethical/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efurther divide populations\u003c/a\u003e into “have” and “have-nots” simply based on who is able to get a vaccine. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAnd, as with anything that can be described as a “digital health pass,” people are raising concerns over privacy and the protection of personal data. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003eexpect the discussion around vaccine passports to heat up even more, although actual implementation may not happen until the summer. The Digital Green Pass would take at least three months to get up and running, the European Commission said.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003ePassports aside, here’s a look at where the vaccine style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eIn the US...\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e82.6 million doses, or 24.9 doses for every 100 people, have been administered, \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/graphics/covid-vaccine-tracker-global-distribution/?sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eaccording to Bloomberg\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e. That’s up from 70.5 million doses last Saturday. 8.4% of the US population is now fully vaccinated.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eAround the world…\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e279 million doses have been administered in 111 different countries, up from 231 million doses in 100 countries last week.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThe latest updates\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eHot out of the gate:\u003c/strong\u003e Covax, the international relief effort to help supply vaccines to low-income countries, delivered \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/world/live-news/coronavirus-pandemic-vaccine-updates-03-05-21/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e20 million doses to 20 countries\u003c/a\u003e in its first week of distribution. The UN-backed organization’s goal is to deliver 2 billion doses by the end of the year. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e#Blocked\u003c/strong\u003e: Earlier this week, Italy \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-03-05/australia-urges-eu-review-after-italy-blocks-astrazeneca-doses?sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eblocked\u003c/a\u003e a shipment of AstraZeneca vaccine doses headed for Australia on the grounds that it needed them more than the Aussies did. style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003e@deeptomcruise on TikTok\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAfter the whole jumping-on-Oprah’s-couch thing, it’s understandable that people will believe Tom Cruise is capable of anything. But videos that went viral on TikTok this week of Cruise golfing and performing magic tricks were actually \u003cem\u003edeepfakes\u003c/em\u003e. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eDeepfake, (dēpfāk), \u003c/strong\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e\u003cem\u003enoun\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e.\u003c/strong\u003e a digitally manipulated video. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eUse it in a sentence: Tom Cruise’s face was glommed onto someone else’s body in a series of \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003edeepfakes\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e this week. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eVisual effects specialist Chris Ume spent months creating the convincing videos, which star a Tom Cruise impersonator augmented with VFX and CGI. Ume \u003ca href=\"https://www.theverge.com/2021/3/5/22314980/tom-cruise-deepfake-tiktok-videos-ai-impersonator-chris-ume-miles-fisher?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etold The Verge\u003c/a\u003e his videos are meant to prove, “You can’t [make convincing deepfakes] by just pressing a button.” \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eDespite his intentions, the videos highlight existing concerns about deepfake technology and how social media companies guard their platforms against misinformation. TikTok \u003ca href=\"https://www.ft.com/content/721da1df-a1e5-4e2f-97fe-6de633ed4826?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebanned\u003c/a\u003e manipulated content in August, but a spokesperson said parodies like Ume’s don’t count. The videos \u003ca href=\"https://www.tiktok.com/@deeptomcruise?lang=en\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eare still live\u003c/a\u003e as of last night. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out:\u003c/strong\u003e With the exception of Internet Explorer, technology tends to improve over time. Deepfakes will only get a) more realistic and b) easier to make.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e+\u003c/strong\u003e \u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eOptional homework: \u003c/strong\u003eWe wrote about deepfakes and how to detect them in our \u003ca
